titleStmt.title: W. P. Comer et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10001

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioners ^the Citizens of Owingsville^ would most respectfully represent to your Excellency, that at the March Term of the Bath Circuit Court J. J. Lightfoot & Simeon Crain, druggists in the town of Owingsville, were fined the sum of $6000 for Selling spiritous liquors..
We the undersigned would most respectfully ask that your Excellency would remit the aforesaid fine.. And your petitioners will ever pray &c

W. P. Comer
V. B. Young
D S Badger
A Trumbo
E. V. Brothers
L Coleman
J. W. Richards
H R Conner
Wm Riche
R M Conner
B. C. Allen
R M Burbridge
Jas F Maury
R. Gudgell
M A Daugherty
B. Hart
R. R. Moore
J A
L Goodpaster
T W Ewing
G. M Ewing
J. A. Turner Jr
W. H. T. Moss
James Kinnard
J
J. H. Richart
H Rutherford
F C Purvis
W Fenwick
Robt Wylie
H. McKinaran
P. P Ewing
William Downing of Garrard Co

Bath Cir. Ct
Respite 12 mo
B. M
$60 } Tipling
Lightfoot & Crane
Issd Jany 22 1861
